revised_title: Fossil Shells and the Evolution of Carnivorous and Herbivorous Trachelipoda
tldr: The author examines the relationship between fossil shells and the evolution of carnivorous and herbivorous Trachelipoda. He observes that herbivorous Trachelipoda are abundant in older formations, while carnivorous ones are more common in strata above the chalk. The author also speculates that a decrease in Earth's temperature may have led to the extinction of some genera and the migration of others to the south.
